question: Using Gibbs' inequality, if \( p_x(i) = 0.3 \) and \( p_y(i) = 0.3 \) for a certain \( i \), calculate the value of \( \sum p_y(i) \log \left( \frac{p_y(i)}{p_x(i)} \right) \).
solution:
Using the values provided:

\[
\sum p_y(i) \log \left( \frac{p_y(i)}{p_x(i)} \right) = p_y(i) \log \left( \frac{0.3}{0.3} \right) = 0.3 \log(1) = 0.3 \times 0 = 0
\]

Thus, the value is:

\[
\boxed{0}
\]
